intro: Bloomeria crocea var. crocea, commonly known as the yellow bloomery, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and features strap-like, evergreen leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
